qas.question: Roughly how many farms are located in Tennesee?
Which livestock is the major focus of Tennessee agriculture?
When did cotton first become a large-scale agricultural product in Tennessee?
Which river landform partly in Tennessee provided the most fertile land for cotton production?

context: Major outputs for the state include textiles, cotton, cattle, and electrical power. Tennessee has over <a0_0>82,000<a0_0/> farms, roughly 59 percent of which accommodate <a1_0>beef cattle<a1_0/>. Although cotton was an early crop in Tennessee, large-scale cultivation of the fiber did not begin until the <a2_0>1820s<a2_0/> with the opening of the land between the Tennessee and Mississippi Rivers. The upper wedge of the <a3_0>Mississippi Delta<a3_0/> extends into southwestern Tennessee, and it was in this fertile section that cotton took hold. Soybeans are also heavily planted in West Tennessee, focusing on the northwest corner of the state.
